fact: Whale sharks can grow as long as a school bus and weigh up to 21 tons!
Some species of sharks can glow in the dark using bioluminescence.
A group of sharks is called a 'shiver' because sharks often shiver when hunting.
The shortfin mako shark is the fastest shark, reaching speeds up to 45 mph!
Sharks have been around for over 400 million years, even before dinosaurs!
Great white sharks can detect a drop of blood in 25 gallons of water.
Tiger sharks are called 'the garbage cans of the sea' because they eat almost anything.
Hammerhead sharks use their wide, flat heads like a metal detector to find stingrays.
A shark's skeleton is made entirely of cartilage, not bone!
Sharks replace their teeth throughout their lives. Some species go through 20,000+ teeth!
